intro: Erodium malacoides, commonly known as the sticky erodium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, bright pink to purple flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance, which can deter herbivores. It typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in coastal areas. Erodium malacoides is an annual herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained conditions.
